title: IKEA’s New Collection Might Be Its "Sparkliest" Yet
description: It’s never too early to start planning for NYE! READ MORE...
author: Amrita Thakkar
excerpt: It’s never too early to start planning for NYE!
text: Kitchen & HomeEntertaining & GatheringProduct Reviews & Recommendationspublished about 4 hours agoWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Jeff Bukowski/ShutterstockIs it too early to start thinking about New Year’s Eve? Well, not according to IKEA. The Swedish giant just launched the sparkliest holiday collection — and it’s perfect for all your winter-themed party needs. IKEA’s new FRÖJDA collection might be the brand’s shiniest yet. Inspired by the gleaming, snowy Swedish landscape, many of the pieces feature a palette of glittering silver and crisp white. If your NYE theme is “winter wonderland,” this is the perfect collection for you (and if it’s not, you might want to consider making it this year’s theme). IKEA’s looking to provide you with all the essentials you need to celebrate every occasion, with everything you need for the table and beyond. The collection features some timeless basics — silverware, plates, napkins, and wineglasses — with the highlight for dishware definitely being the Champagne coupes. At just $20 for a four-pack, these are a steal (considering IKEA’s glassware often looks far more elegant than the price tag would suggest). If you’re going to be hosting a larger party, it’s a superbly cost-effective way to serve your guests. And as a bonus, the napkins are made with leftover material from sheet production, so you can start 2025 on a sustainable note. The real standouts, though, are the decor pieces. The snowflake-shaped pendant light is a personal favorite of mine; it’s made of powder-coated steel with a light at each point. Because the lights are only $25 each, you can set up a few to create a scene straight out of a fairytale.
html:
• Kitchen & Home
  • Entertaining & Gathering
  • Product Reviews & Recommendations

published about 4 hours ago

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Is it too early to start thinking about New Year’s Eve? Well, not according to IKEA. The Swedish giant just launched the sparkliest holiday collection — and it’s perfect for all your winter-themed party needs. 

IKEA’s new FRÖJDA collection might be the brand’s shiniest yet. Inspired by the gleaming, snowy Swedish landscape, many of the pieces feature a palette of glittering silver and crisp white. If your NYE theme is “winter wonderland,” this is the perfect collection for you (and if it’s not, you might want to consider making it this year’s theme). IKEA’s looking to provide you with all the essentials you need to celebrate every occasion, with everything you need for the table and beyond. 

The collection features some timeless basics — silverware, plates, napkins, and wineglasses — with the highlight for dishware definitely being the Champagne coupes. At just $20 for a four-pack, these are a steal (considering IKEA’s glassware often looks far more elegant than the price tag would suggest). If you’re going to be hosting a larger party, it’s a superbly cost-effective way to serve your guests. And as a bonus, the napkins are made with leftover material from sheet production, so you can start 2025 on a sustainable note. 

The real standouts, though, are the decor pieces. The snowflake-shaped pendant light is a personal favorite of mine; it’s made of powder-coated steel with a light at each point. Because the lights are only $25 each, you can set up a few to create a scene straight out of a fairytale.
